strangerIntro.text: Stranger: 'Hey, you. You’re finally awake. You were trying to cross the border, right? Walked right into that monster ambush wreckage, same as me, and that thief over there.'

thiefIntro.text: Thief: 'Damn you, lady. If you just let me go, I’ll pay you back.'

strangerReply1.text: Mercina: 'Yeah, yeah, like you didn’t just try to steal from me.'

thiefReply1.text: Thief: 'Well, next time, don’t leave your wagon unattended.'

strangerReply2.text: Mercina: 'You’re lucky I picked you up in that wreckage. You were just lying there—who knows for how long? Near enough to that monster ambush to freeze solid. Honestly, it’s a miracle you’re alive.'

strangerReply3.text: Mercina: 'You should rest for now. You looked like you were going to die of cold when I found you.'

strangerIntroName.text: Mercina: 'Oh, how could I forget? I’m Mercina. I’m a merchant on my way to town, and that’s how I found you.'

playerNameReply.text: Simon: 'I… I don’t know… I don’t remember anything.'

strangerNameSuggestion.text: Mercina: 'Well, I can’t call you without a name. Just give me something to call you in the meantime.'

thiefChimesIn.text: Thief: 'You seriously don’t know about this?'

merchantCurseTalk.text: Mercina: 'Well, during the war, a lot of people got mutated or cursed, you know. You’re lucky if it’s just your hand like mine. Others… well, others got turned into something much worse.'

merchantHandExplanation.text: Mercina: 'My hand? Oh, it’s nothing. Just a little reminder of what happens when you wander too far from safety. I call it my cursed blessing. Lets me carry more, but I don’t think it’ll ever feel warm again.'

choices.text: 'A cursed blessing? That’s an odd way to put it.'

thiefComment1.text: Thief: 'You’re not cursed or mutated, are you? You’d fetch a high price in the market, heh.'

merchantReplyToThief.text: Mercina: 'Quiet, thief! Or I might sell you myself.'

choices.text: 'I think I’d like to see that.'

wolfHowl.text: - A distant wolf howl echoes through the frozen wilderness. -

thiefWarnsWolves.text: Thief: 'Wolves! At this time? They’re hungrier than usual in this endless winter.'

merchantRepliesWolves.text: Mercina: 'Ugh, what terrible luck. They must have caught our scent.'

thiefPleaUnbind.text: Thief: 'You gotta unbind me, lady, or we’re all going to die!'

playerOpensCrates.text: Mercina: 'Hey, Simon! Do me a favor and open those crates. It’s not much, but take what you need.'

choices.text: 'A sword. I’ll fight as a Warrior.'
'A bow. I’ll take the path of a Ranger.'
'Bare hands. I’ll fight as a Monk.'

classChosen.text: - You feel the weight of your chosen weapon, a sense of purpose coursing through you. -

wolvesAttack.text: - The wolves emerge from the shadows, their eyes gleaming with hunger. The air feels sharper, colder, as their growls echo around you. -

wolvesDefeated.text: - The wolves lie motionless, their once-menacing forms now just shadows in the snow. The chill in the air begins to feel less hostile. -

mercinaPostBattle.text: Mercina: 'We wouldn’t have made it without you. Maybe you’re more capable than I thought.'

choices.text: 'It wasn’t just me. We all fought.'

thiefPostBattle.text: Thief: 'Nice moves back there. I’d almost trust you to watch my back. Almost.'

wolfCorpseDiscovery.text:
- Mercina kneels by one of the wolves, inspecting its wounds. Her expression darkens. -
Mercina: 'These weren’t ordinary wolves... Look at this.'

mutatedWolfExplanation.text: Mercina: 'The scars, the extra eyes… This is no accident. Someone’s been tampering with these creatures.'

thiefInterjectsMutation.text: Thief: 'Whoever’s behind this, I don’t want to meet them. We should move. Fast.'

roadContinues.text: - You gather your supplies and press on, the snow crunching beneath your boots. The unsettling silence returns, broken only by the occasional howl of the wind. -
